name: Sopa de Tortilla (Real Mexican Tortilla Soup)
author: jackie
summary: Corn tortilla strips in a chicken broth seasoned with tomatoes and pasilla chile. An authentic Mexican soup served with avocado, Mexican cheese, and crema.
ingredients: 12 (6 inch) corn tortillas, cut into strips
directions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat
Add tortilla strips in batches and fry until brown and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes per batch
Remove from heat and drain on paper towels
Fry pasilla chiles in the same pan, being careful not to burn them, until browned, about 2 minutes
Remove from oil and drain on paper towels
Combine 1 fried pasilla pepper, tomatoes, onion, garlic, and oregano in a blender; blend until smooth
Strain through a sieve into a bowl
Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a saucepan over medium heat
Add tomato mixture and cook for 2 minutes
Pour in water and bring to a boil
Stir in chicken granules and parsley
Cover and simmer over low heat until flavors are well combined, about 15 minutes
Remove from heat and discard parsley
Divide fried tortilla strips among 4 bowls
Pour soup on top of tortilla strips and garnish with diced avocado and cotija cheese
Cut remaining fried pasilla peppers into thin strips and sprinkle over soup
Add Mexican crema to each bowl
